required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the this surveillance is to collect information about 1)adverse drug reactions not expected from the LPD (unknown adverse drug reactions), 2) the incidence of adverse drug reactions in this surveillance, and 3) factors considered to affect the safety and/or efficacy of this drug.

detailed_description.textblock: All the patients whom an investigator prescribes the first Gabapentin should be registered consecutively until the number of subjects reaches target number in order to extract patients enrolled into the investigation at random.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events Unexpected From Japanese Package Insert
primary_outcome.description: A treatment-related adverse event was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to gabapentin in a participant who received gabapentin. Expectedness of the adverse event was determined according to the Japanese package insert. Relatedness to gabapentin was assessed by the sponsor (Pfizer Japan Inc.).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: A treatment-related adverse event was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to gabapentin in a participant who received gabapentin. Relatedness to gabapentin was assessed by the sponsor (Pfizer Japan Inc.).

Clinical efficacy rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants who achieved clinical efficacy over the total number of efficacy analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding exact 2-sided 95% CI. For the basis of efficacy evaluation, frequencies of epileptic seizure were recorded for the periods during the previous 4 weeks from the treatment start date, and that from the end date of observation (12 weeks after the treatment start date, or date of which treatment was terminated before reaching 12 weeks). Clinical efficacy was assessed according to the following categories: (1) effective, (2) not effective, or (3) not assessable.

secondary_outcome.description: Response Ratio (R Ratio) was calculated by the following formula, where B represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks before gabapentin treatment, whereas T represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks at the end of observation period of gabapentin treatment: R Ratio= (T-B) / (T+B). R Ratio was within the range of -1 to +1, and a negative value represented a reduction in the frequency of seizure.

Responder rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants whose R ratio was -0.333 or less, was presented along with the corresponding exact 2-sided 95% CI. R ratio of -0.333 or less corresponded to the decrease of epileptic seizure frequency by 50% or more.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Reduction From Baseline in Epileptic Seizure Frequency
secondary_outcome.description: Percent reduction from the baseline in epileptic seizure frequency, was calculated by the following formula, where B represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks before gabapentin treatment, whereas T represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks at the end of observation period of gabapentin treatment: Reduction from the baseline in epileptic seizure frequency (%) = [(T-B)/B] X 100.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events by Age Across 7 Categories
other_outcome.description: A treatment-related adverse event was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to gabapentin in a participant who received gabapentin. Participants with treatment-related adverse events were counted by age across 7 categories to assess whether the age was a risk factor for the treatment-related adverse events.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events by Number of Concomitant Antiepileptic Drugs at Baseline
other_outcome.description: A treatment-related adverse event was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to gabapentin in a participant who received gabapentin. Participants with treatment-related adverse events were counted by the number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline across 5 categories to assess whether the number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline was a risk factor for the treatment-related adverse events.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Age (<65 Versus >=65 Years)
other_outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by age (<65 vs. >=65 years) to assess whether the age was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Age Across 7 Categories
other_outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by age across 7 categories to assess whether the age was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Severity of Partial Epileptic Seizure
other_outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the severity of partial epileptic seizure (mild, moderate and severe) to assess whether the severity of partial epileptic seizure was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Baseline Frequency of Epileptic Seizure
other_outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the baseline frequency of epileptic seizure (<=8 vs. >8 episodes) to assess whether the baseline frequency of epileptic seizure was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Number of Concomitant Antiepileptic Drugs at Baseline
other_outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the number of concomitant epileptic drugs at baseline across 5 categories to assess whether the number of concomitant epileptic drugs at baseline was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Baseline Creatinine Clearance
other_outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the baseline creatinine clearance (CLcr) across 6 categories to assess whether the baseline CLcr was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Presence or Absence of Non-Drug Therapy
other_outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the presence or absence of non-drug therapy to assess whether the non-drug therapy was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.

intervention.description: GABAPEN Tablets 200mg, GABAPEN Tablets 300mg, GABAPEN Tablets 400mg. GABAPEN is Brand name in Japan. Dosage, frequency: According to Japanese LPD, "Normally, oral gabapentin 600 mg, 3 div., should be given on the first day of administration and an effective dose of 1200mg, 3 div, should be given on day 2. From day 3 on, adults should be maintained on oral gabapentin 1200 mg to 1800 mg, 3 div. Subsequently, the maintenance dose should be suitably adjusted depending on the symptoms (up to a maximum daily dose of 2400 mg)". Duration: According to the protocol of A9451163, the duration of the investigation for findings regarding safety and efficacy of a patient is from the first drug administration to the 12 weeks after the first administration.

study_pop.textblock: The patients whom an investigator involving A9451163 prescribes the Gabapentin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients need to be taking Gabapentin in order to be enrolled in the surveillance
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients not taking Gabapentin

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Gabapentin 200, 300, 400 mg Tablets
group.description: The usual dosage of gabapentin in adults and children aged 13 or older was as follows: oral gabapentin 600 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 1 and an effective dose of 1200 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 2. From day 3 on, oral gabapentin 1200 mg to 1800 mg, 3 div., was administered as the maintenance dose. Subsequently, the maintenance dose was suitably adjusted depending on the symptoms (up to a maximum daily dose of 2400 mg).

drop_withdraw_reason.title: No Visit After First Day of Treatment

baseline.population: In total, 1194 participants were enrolled in the study. Of the 1194 participants, a total of 50 participants were excluded from the baseline analysis for the following reasons: protocol violation, lost to follow-up, no visit after first day of treatment, no drug administration, and safety evaluation "Not Assessable".

group.title: Gabapentin 200, 300, 400 mg Tablets
group.description: The usual dosage of gabapentin in adults and children aged 13 or older was as follows: oral gabapentin 600 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 1 and an effective dose of 1200 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 2. From day 3 on, oral gabapentin 1200 mg to 1800 mg, 3 div., was administered as the maintenance dose. Subsequently, the maintenance dose was suitably adjusted depending on the symptoms (up to a maximum daily dose of 2400 mg).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events
measure.description: A treatment-related adverse event was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to gabapentin in a participant who received gabapentin. Relatedness to gabapentin was assessed by the sponsor (Pfizer Japan Inc.).
measure.population: The safety analysis population comprised of participants who had met the inclusion criteria and had taken gabapentin at least once.

outcome.title: Clinical Efficacy Rate
outcome.description: Clinical efficacy rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants who achieved clinical efficacy over the total number of efficacy analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding exact 2-sided 95% CI. For the basis of efficacy evaluation, frequencies of epileptic seizure were recorded for the periods during the previous 4 weeks from the treatment start date, and that from the end date of observation (12 weeks after the treatment start date, or date of which treatment was terminated before reaching 12 weeks). Clinical efficacy was assessed according to the following categories: (1) effective, (2) not effective, or (3) not assessable.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency within the safety analysis population. Participants who had disease not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

group.title: Gabapentin 200, 300, 400 mg Tablets
group.description: The usual dosage of gabapentin in adults and children aged 13 or older was as follows: oral gabapentin 600 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 1 and an effective dose of 1200 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 2. From day 3 on, oral gabapentin 1200 mg to 1800 mg, 3 div., was administered as the maintenance dose. Subsequently, the maintenance dose was suitably adjusted depending on the symptoms (up to a maximum daily dose of 2400 mg).

measure.title: Clinical Efficacy Rate
measure.description: Clinical efficacy rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants who achieved clinical efficacy over the total number of efficacy analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding exact 2-sided 95% CI. For the basis of efficacy evaluation, frequencies of epileptic seizure were recorded for the periods during the previous 4 weeks from the treatment start date, and that from the end date of observation (12 weeks after the treatment start date, or date of which treatment was terminated before reaching 12 weeks). Clinical efficacy was assessed according to the following categories: (1) effective, (2) not effective, or (3) not assessable.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency within the safety analysis population. Participants who had disease not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

outcome.title: Response Ratio (R Ratio)
outcome.description: Response Ratio (R Ratio) was calculated by the following formula, where B represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks before gabapentin treatment, whereas T represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks at the end of observation period of gabapentin treatment: R Ratio= (T-B) / (T+B). R Ratio was within the range of -1 to +1, and a negative value represented a reduction in the frequency of seizure.
outcome.population: R ratio analysis population comprised of the participants who calculated R ratio at the start of gabapentin treatment and at the end of monitoring period in the efficacy analysis population.

group.title: Gabapentin 200, 300, 400 mg Tablets
group.description: The usual dosage of gabapentin in adults and children aged 13 or older was as follows: oral gabapentin 600 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 1 and an effective dose of 1200 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 2. From day 3 on, oral gabapentin 1200 mg to 1800 mg, 3 div., was administered as the maintenance dose. Subsequently, the maintenance dose was suitably adjusted depending on the symptoms (up to a maximum daily dose of 2400 mg).

measure.title: Response Ratio (R Ratio)
measure.description: Response Ratio (R Ratio) was calculated by the following formula, where B represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks before gabapentin treatment, whereas T represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks at the end of observation period of gabapentin treatment: R Ratio= (T-B) / (T+B). R Ratio was within the range of -1 to +1, and a negative value represented a reduction in the frequency of seizure.
measure.population: R ratio analysis population comprised of the participants who calculated R ratio at the start of gabapentin treatment and at the end of monitoring period in the efficacy analysis population.

outcome.title: Responder Rate
outcome.description: Responder rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants whose R ratio was -0.333 or less, was presented along with the corresponding exact 2-sided 95% CI. R ratio of -0.333 or less corresponded to the decrease of epileptic seizure frequency by 50% or more.
outcome.population: Responder rate analysis population comprised of the participants who calculated R ratio at the start of gabapentin treatment and at the end of monitoring period in the efficacy analysis population.

group.title: Gabapentin 200, 300, 400 mg Tablets
group.description: The usual dosage of gabapentin in adults and children aged 13 or older was as follows: oral gabapentin 600 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 1 and an effective dose of 1200 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 2. From day 3 on, oral gabapentin 1200 mg to 1800 mg, 3 div., was administered as the maintenance dose. measure.title: Responder Rate
measure.description: Responder rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants whose R ratio was -0.333 or less, was presented along with the corresponding exact 2-sided 95% CI. R ratio of -0.333 or less corresponded to the decrease of epileptic seizure frequency by 50% or more.
measure.population: Responder rate analysis population comprised of the participants who calculated R ratio at the start of gabapentin treatment and at the end of monitoring period in the efficacy analysis population.

outcome.title: Percent Reduction From Baseline in Epileptic Seizure Frequency
outcome.description: Percent reduction from the baseline in epileptic seizure frequency, was calculated by the following formula, where B represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks before gabapentin treatment, whereas T represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks at the end of observation period of gabapentin treatment: Reduction from the baseline in epileptic seizure frequency (%) = [(T-B)/B] X 100.
outcome.population: The analysis population comprised of the participants whose frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks before gabapentin treatment (represented by B) was at least once within the R ratio analysis population.

group.title: Gabapentin 200, 300, 400 mg Tablets
group.description: The usual dosage of gabapentin in adults and children aged 13 or older was as follows: oral gabapentin 600 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 1 and an effective dose of 1200 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 2. From day 3 on, oral gabapentin 1200 mg to 1800 mg, 3 div., was administered as the maintenance dose. measure.title: Percent Reduction From Baseline in Epileptic Seizure Frequency
measure.description: Percent reduction from the baseline in epileptic seizure frequency, was calculated by the following formula, where B represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks before gabapentin treatment, whereas T represented the frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks at the end of observation period of gabapentin treatment: Reduction from the baseline in epileptic seizure frequency (%) = [(T-B)/B] X 100.
measure.population: The analysis population comprised of the participants whose frequency of epileptic seizures during 4 weeks before gabapentin treatment (represented by B) was at least once within the R ratio analysis population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events by Age Across 7 Categories
outcome.description: A treatment-related adverse event was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to gabapentin in a participant who received gabapentin. Participants with treatment-related adverse events were counted by age across 7 categories to assess whether the age was a risk factor for the treatment-related adverse events.
outcome.population: The safety analysis population comprised of participants who had met the inclusion criteria and had taken gabapentin at least once.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related Adverse Events by Age Across 7 Categories
measure.description: A treatment-related adverse event was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to gabapentin in a participant who received gabapentin. Participants with treatment-related adverse events were counted by age across 7 categories to assess whether the age was a risk factor for the treatment-related adverse events.
measure.population: The safety analysis population comprised of participants who had met the inclusion criteria and had taken gabapentin at least once.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "age". The null hypothesis was that there was no association between the age and the number of responders to the treatment with gabapentin.

Participants with treatment-related adverse events were counted by the number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline across 5 categories to assess whether the number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline was a risk factor for the treatment-related adverse events.
outcome.population: The safety analysis population comprised of participants who had met the inclusion criteria and had taken gabapentin at least once.

Participants with treatment-related adverse events were counted by the number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline across 5 categories to assess whether the number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline was a risk factor for the treatment-related adverse events.
measure.population: The safety analysis population comprised of participants who had met the inclusion criteria and had taken gabapentin at least once.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline". The null hypothesis was that there was no linear trend in the number of responders to the treatment with gabapentin across increasing levels of the number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline.

The risk factor tested was "number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline". The null hypothesis was that there was no linear trend in the number of responders to the treatment with gabapentin across increasing levels of the number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline.

outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

analysis.groups_desc: The factor tested was "age". The null hypothesis was that there was no difference between <65 years and >=65 years in the number of participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin.

analysis.groups_desc: The factor tested was "age". The null hypothesis was that there was no association between the age and the number of participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin.
The factor tested was "age". The null hypothesis was that there was no linear trend in the number of responders to the treatment with gabapentin across increasing levels of age categories.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Severity of Partial Epileptic Seizure
outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the severity of partial epileptic seizure (mild, moderate and severe) to assess whether the severity of partial epileptic seizure was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

group.title: Mild
group.description: Participants with mild epilepsy who responded to the treatment with gabapentin

group.title: Moderate
group.description: Participants with moderate epilepsy who responded to the treatment with gabapentin

group.title: Severe
group.description: Participants with severe epilepsy who responded to the treatment with gabapentin

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Severity of Partial Epileptic Seizure
measure.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the severity of partial epileptic seizure (mild, moderate and severe) to assess whether the severity of partial epileptic seizure was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

analysis.groups_desc: The factor tested was "severity of partial epileptic seizure ". The null hypothesis was that there was no association between the degree of severity of partial epileptic seizure (mild, moderate, and severe) and the number of participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin.

The factor tested was "severity of partial epileptic seizure". The null hypothesis was that there was no linear trend in the number of responders to the treatment with gabapentin across the degree of severity of partial epileptic seizure (mild, moderate, and severe).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Baseline Frequency of Epileptic Seizure
outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the baseline frequency of epileptic seizure (<=8 vs. >8 episodes) to assess whether the baseline frequency of epileptic seizure was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

group.title: <=8 Episodes
group.description: Participants with baseline episodes of epileptic seizure below 8 who responded to the treatment with gabapentin

group.title: >8 Episodes
group.description: Participants with baseline episodes of epileptic seizure more than 8 who responded to the treatment with gabapentin

group.title: Unknown
group.description: Participants with unknown frequency of baseline episodes who responded to the treatment with gabapentin

measure.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

analysis.groups_desc: The factor tested was "baseline frequency of epileptic seizure". The null hypothesis was that there was no difference between the baseline frequency of epileptic seizure and the number of participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Number of Concomitant Antiepileptic Drugs at Baseline
outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the number of concomitant epileptic drugs at baseline across 5 categories to assess whether the number of concomitant epileptic drugs at baseline was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

group.description: Participants taking four or more concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Number of Concomitant Antiepileptic Drugs at Baseline
measure.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the number of concomitant epileptic drugs at baseline across 5 categories to assess whether the number of concomitant epileptic drugs at baseline was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

analysis.groups_desc: The factor tested was "number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline". The null hypothesis was that there was no association between the number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline and the number of participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin.

The factor tested was "number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline". The null hypothesis was that there was no linear trend in the number of responders to the treatment with gabapentin across increasing levels of the number of concomitant antiepileptic drugs at baseline.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Baseline Creatinine Clearance
outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the baseline creatinine clearance (CLcr) across 6 categories to assess whether the baseline CLcr was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

group.title: CLcr >=60 mL/Min
group.description: Participants with baseline creatinine clearance >=60 mL/min

group.title: CLcr >=30 and <60 mL/Min
group.description: Participants with baseline creatinine clearance >=30 and <60 mL/min

group.title: CLcr >=15 and <30 mL/Min
group.description: Participants with baseline creatinine clearance >=15 and <30 mL/min

group.title: CLcr >=5 and <15 mL/Min
group.description: Participants with baseline creatinine clearance >=5 and <15 mL/min

group.title: CLcr <5 mL/Min
group.description: Participants with baseline creatinine clearance <5 mL/min

group.title: Unkown
group.description: Participants with unkown baseline creatinine clearance

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Baseline Creatinine Clearance
measure.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the baseline creatinine clearance (CLcr) across 6 categories to assess whether the baseline CLcr was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

analysis.groups_desc: The factor tested was "baseline creatinine clearance". The null hypothesis was that there was no linear trend in the number of responders to the treatment with gabapentin across increasing levels of the baseline creatinine clearance.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Presence or Absence of Non-Drug Therapy
outcome.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the presence or absence of non-drug therapy to assess whether the non-drug therapy was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

group.title: Presence of Non-Drug Therapy
group.description: Participants with non-drug therapy who responded to treatment with gabapentin

group.title: Absence of Non-Drug Therapy
group.description: Participants without non-drug therapy who responded to treatment with gabapentin

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment With Gabapentin by Presence or Absence of Non-Drug Therapy
measure.description: Participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin were counted by the presence or absence of non-drug therapy to assess whether the non-drug therapy was a factor affecting the treatment efficacy.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis population comprised of the participants who had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation for the clinical efficacy and seizure frequency in the safety analysis population. Participants who had diseases not eligible for the survey were excluded from the efficacy analysis population.

analysis.groups_desc: The factor tested was "non-drug therapy". The null hypothesis was that there was no difference between the non-drug therapy and the number of participants who responded to the treatment with gabapentin.

reported_events.desc: The frequency of adverse events. The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Gabapentin 200, 300, 400 mg Tablets
group.description: The usual dosage of gabapentin in adults and children aged 13 or older was as follows: oral gabapentin 600 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 1 and an effective dose of 1200 mg, 3 div., was administered on day 2. From day 3 on, oral gabapentin 1200 mg to 1800 mg, 3 div., was administered as the maintenance dose. Subsequently, the maintenance dose was suitably adjusted depending on the symptoms (up to a maximum daily dose of 2400 mg).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
